intro: Maytenus laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered mayten, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Phyllanthaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often gland-dotted. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round berries that turn red when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry forests and along riverbanks. Maytenus laxiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
